level.text: Each grantee receiving EES financial assistance under this chapter shall keep accurate records which fully disclose the amount and disposition for each grantee and subgrantee of the funds received, and any other records as may be necessary for an effective audit and performance evaluation.
Each grantee receiving funds shall submit program performance report and a financial report as requested by the Program Manager.
Each report shall contain such information as the Director may prescribe in order to effectively monitor the progress of a grantee.

The grantee shall make all records available to the Director for review by the U.S. Department of Energy, the District of Columbia government and federal officials as deemed necessary. All records shall be retained for period of at least three (3) years following final close-out of the grant.
